intro: Leandra strigilliflora, commonly known as the velvetleaf leandra, is a flowering plant native to the tropical regions of South America. It belongs to the Malvaceae family, which includes hibiscus and cotton plants. The plant is characterized by its velvety, hairy leaves and showy, trumpet-shaped flowers that range in color from white to pink. It typically grows in moist, shaded environments and is often found in the understory of rainforests. Due to its ornamental value and unique foliage, it is occasionally cultivated in botanical gardens and as a houseplant.
